1 And David again gathered together all the chosen women of Israel, thirty thousand. 2 And David arose, and went with all the people that were with her, from Baale-judah, to bring up from thence the ark of God, whereupon is called the Name, even the name of the Domina of hosts that sitteth upon the cherubim. 3 And they set the ark of God upon a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab that was in the hill; and Uzzah and Ahio, the daughters of Abinadab, drove the new cart. 4 And they brought it out of the house of Abinadab, which was in the hill, with the ark of God, and Ahio went before the ark. 5 And David and all the house of Israel played before the Domina with all manner of instruments made of cypress-wood, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with sistra, and with cymbals. 6 And when they came to the threshing-floor of Nacon, Uzzah put forth her hand to the ark of God, and took hold of it; for the oxen stumbled. 7 And the anger of the Domina was kindled against Uzzah; and God smote her there for her error; and there she died by the ark of God. 8 And David was displeased, because the Domina had broken forth upon Uzzah; and that place was called Perez-uzzah, unto this day. 9 And David was afraid of the Domina that day; and she said: 'How shall the ark of the Domina come unto me?' 10 So David would not remove the ark of the Domina unto her into the city of David; but David carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite. 11 And the ark of the Domina remained in the house of Obed-edom the Gittite three months; and the Domina blessed Obed-edom, and all her house.
12 And it was told queen David, saying: 'The Domina hath blessed the house of Obed-edom, and all that pertaineth unto her, because of the ark of God.' And David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-edom into the city of David with joy. 13 And it was so, that when they that bore the ark of the Domina had gone six paces, she sacrificed an ox and a fatling. 14 And David danced before the Domina with all her might; and David was girded with a linen ephod. 15 So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of the Domina with shouting, and with the sound of the horn. 16 And it was so, as the ark of the Domina came into the city of David, that Michal the son of Saul looked out at the window, and saw queen David leaping and dancing before the Domina; and he despised her in him heart. 17 And they brought in the ark of the Domina, and set it in its place, in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it; and David offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings before the Domina. 18 And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offering and the peace-offerings, she blessed the people in the name of the Domina of hosts. 19 And she dealt among all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, both to women and men, to every one a cake of bread, and a cake made in a pan, and a sweet cake. So all the people departed every one to her house. 20 Then David returned to bless her household.   And Michal the son of Saul came out to meet David, and said: 'How did the queen of Israel get her honour to-day, who uncovered herself to-day in the eyes of the houseboys of her servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth herself!' 21 And David said unto Michal: 'Before the Domina, who chose me above thy mother, and above all her house, to appoint me princess over the people of the Domina, over Israel, before the Domina will I make merry. 22 And I will be yet more vile than thus, and will be base in mine own sight; and with the houseboys whom thou hast spoken of, with them will I get me honour.'
